璂字的基本解释

璂
qí
古代皮件缝合处的玉饰。

璂字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qí］
［《廣韻》渠之切，平之，羣。］
古代弁上结缝处的玉饰。

璂字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【玉字部】　璂； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页740第25
【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】渠之切【正韻】渠宜切，?音其。【周禮·夏官·弁師】王之皮弁，會五采玉璂。【註】鄭康成曰：讀如綦。綦，結也。皮弁之縫中，每貫結五采玉十二以爲飾。詩曰會弁如星是也。

璂字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
璂字的起名意思

古代皮件缝合处的玉饰。

Jing
Basic explanation of words
Jing
qí
The jade ornaments at the seams of ancient leather goods.
Jing
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qí］
["Guangyun" Qu Zhiqi, Ping Zhi, Qun. ]
The jade ornaments at the knots on the ancient bend.
Jing
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Wu Ji 1] [Jade Character Department] 　璂; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 740 25
[Tang Yun] [Ji Yun] [Rhyme Meeting] Qu Zhi cut [Zheng Yun] Qu Yi cut,? Sound it. 【Zhou Li·Xiaguan·Bian Shi】Wang Zhi Pi Bian, knows how to pick jade carvings. [Note] Zheng Kangcheng said: Reading Ruqi. Qi, knot also. In the seams of Piben, each knot is connected with five jade and twelve pieces for decoration. The poem says Huibian is like a star.
Jing
